title: Accidently Stopped PVP.net
body: So, I started getting the "PVP.net Patcher Kernel is not working" message.  I saw on a message board something about stopping it in task manager (I think.  Who knows what it really said, I was a bit rushed to play the game).  So I went into Task Manager, found PVP.net Patcher Kernel, and hit End Task.  Now, I am still getting the error message - and I can't figure out how to undo what I did!

replies.body: The kernel error are usually caused bys ecurity configurations that's blocking the game from opening.  Go over the steps in the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to get it fixed up.  Let me know if you have any questions!

So I tried the usual stuff.  Except I couldn't do the RADS thing because I didn't have the right folder.  But then I did the run as administrator thing.  It patched up to 99% but then it wouldn't apply the patches.
